docs.lead_paragraph: Correction| Friday, Oct. 9, 4:31 p.m. Because of an error in an A.F.L.-C.I.O. news release, an earlier version of this article erroneously reported that David Arellanes, a retired phone company worker, and his wife had lost their house as a result of high medical bills. They did file for personal bankruptcy, but they have not lost their house.

docs.lead_paragraph: Verisk Analytics, an insurance data specialist that first signaled that it planned to offer shares to the public shortly before the collapse of Lehman Brothers, saw its stock jump Wednesday in its trading debut, The Associated Press said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Citigroup's board met on Tuesday to discuss the findings of a government-ordered review of the bank's leadership, a move that could lead to yet another management shake-up at the company, The New York Times's Eric Dash reported, citing a person briefed on the meeting.
